feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:02PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Heavy rain in the Brooks Range several days ago is causing high water and some flooding on the Upper Koyukuk River. The lower Koyukuk river will rise over the next several days and crest at Huslia on Wednesday or Thursday. Water levels will remain high as Huslia from Wednesday through next weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Chandalar River Through Monday... High water is now moving down the Chandalar River from heavy rain and heavy snowmelt in the Brooks Range several days ago. This high water will move downstream into the Yukon Flats tonight and Monday and could cause water to rise. Water will cover gravel bars and there will be lots of logs and other debris coming down

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Fortymile River Through Monday... The Fortymile River saw very sharp rises in the river Saturday night and Sunday from heavy rain that fell on Saturday. No flooding was reported, but the river got high and covered some gravel bars. There will be lots of logs and other debris coming down the river.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.summary: ...SHOWERS AND THUNDERSTORMS AGAIN TODAY AND TUESDAY... * Numerous showers and thunderstorms are expected today with only a slight decrease in coverage Tuesday. entry.title: Hydrologic Outlook issued June 11 at 11:25AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: For the Owyhee River, the following locations are included: Wildhorse Dam. ...Snowmelt and rainfall have increased the wildhorse reservoir to 6205 ft which is action stage... * AT 10:15 AM Sunday, June 11th, the stage was 6205 feet. * FLOOD STAGE IS 6208 feet.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 11 at 11:02AM PDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Schurz affecting Mineral County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases are causing high river flows. Flooding downstream from Weber Dam is ongoing. Some low lying and agricultural areas below Weber are flooded, including some rural access roads. There are reports of stranded cattle on higher islands

entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Nevada... entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 11 at 10:42AM PDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Snowmelt and increased reservoir releases will keep the river oscillating within Moderate Flood Stage. Runoff of rain from thunderstorms into tributaries above and below Mason could further exacerbate river flows.
